title: Fibonacci With a Twist
text:
Fibonacci numbers are given byf(n) = f(n-1) + f(n-2)with f(0) = 0 and f(1) = 1.first number of series — 0  1  1  2  3  5  8  13Now let's have a new series called "Fibonacci Twist" which is given byft(n) = ft(n-1) + ft(n-2) + (n-1)with ft(0) = 0 and ft(1) = 1.with first few number in the series — 0  1  2  5  10  19  34  59Now your task is to find ft(n).Since the number can be big you have to find the result mod M.Inputfirst line having single number 't' — number of test cases.Next t lines have 2 number each 'n' and 'M'OutputSingle number given the n-th term mod MExampleInput:3
5 20
10 77
15 111Output:19
45
69Constraints10 ≤ t ≤ 1000 ≤ n ≤ 109100 ≤ M ≤ 109Explanationft(5) is 19. 19 % 20 = 19ft(10) is 276.  276 % 77  = 45ft(15) is 3177. 3177 % 111 = 69
